oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Battlefields; Historic sites; Houses
Franklin, Battle of, Franklin, Tenn., 1864
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Carter House in Franklin. It is a small house with two windows in front and a door in the center of the house.
Built in 1830 by Fountain Branch Carter, the Carter House was caught in the middle of the Battle of Franklin, one of the bloodiest battles of the American Civil War on November 30, 1864.
